newsitem.title: USA: Military helicopter crashes in Dallas.
newsitem.headline: Military helicopter crashes in Dallas.

text.p: A military helicopter crashed into a field near a southeast Dallas school on Friday and it appeared there were no survivors, officials said.

"We think it was some kind of Marine helicopter," Dallas firefighter Raymond Sweeney told Reuters. "We don't know how many people were on board." There was no indication that anyone on the ground was killed or injured in the crash.
Fire teams raced to the scene and put out the blaze as police sealed off the area less than a mile from the intersection of two major highways in the southeast Dallas suburb of Hutchins.
The helicopter came down in a field behind Hutchins High School and rescue teams searched the area for possible survivors.
Witnesses said the helicopter narrowly missed slamming into a house as it came down.
"It was right over the house so whoever was piloting it is a hero in my books because he could have killed us all," local resident Velva Washburn said.
